SCU_Reset_RESET001 App
void RESET001_AssertReset (RESET001_ResetnType Resetn)
 This function is to enable reset of peripheral by software.
void RESET001_DeassertReset (RESET001_ResetnType Resetn)
 This function is used to clear the Reset of the desired peripheral ( de-assert reset).

 API to get the reason of last reset.

 Get the reset status of the peripheral.

Function Documentation

void RESET001_AssertReset ( RESET001_ResetnType  Resetn)

This function is to enable reset of peripheral by software.

Parameters:
[in]ResetnPeripheral ID
Returns:
void

Reentrant: NO

Example: 

 #include <DAVE3.h>
 int main(void)
 {
    uint32_t status = 0;
    DAVE_Init();
    // Assert the module
    RESET001_AssertReset(PER0_ERU1);
    // Get the status  of the module
    status = RESET001_GetStatus(PER0_ERU1);
    if(status == 1)
    {
      // De-assert the module
      RESET001_DeassertReset(PER0_ERU1);
    }
  }


Definition at line 105 of file RESET001.c.

References CLEAR_BITMASK, and RESET_BITMASK.

void RESET001_DeassertReset ( RESET001_ResetnType  Resetn)

This function is used to clear the Reset of the desired peripheral ( de-assert reset).

Parameters:
[in]ResetnPeripheral ID
Returns:
void

Reentrant: NO

Example: 

 #include <DAVE3.h>
 int main(void)
 {
    uint32_t status = 0;
    DAVE_Init();
    // Assert the module
    RESET001_AssertReset(PER0_ERU1);
    // Get the status  of the module
    status = RESET001_GetStatus(PER0_ERU1);
    if(status == 1)
    {
      // De-assert the module
      RESET001_DeassertReset(PER0_ERU1);
    }
  }

References CLEAR_BITMASK, and RESET_BITMASK.

RESET001_InfoType RESET001_GetResetInfo ( void  )

API to get the reason of last reset.

Returns:
RESET001_InfoType enum value

Reentrant: NO

Example: 

 #include <DAVE3.h>
 int main(void)
 {
    RESET001_InfoType ResetInfo;
    DAVE_Init();
    // Get the Information about last reset
    ResetInfo = RESET001_GetResetInfo();
  }


Definition at line 130 of file RESET001.c.

status_t RESET001_GetStatus ( RESET001_ResetnType  Resetn)

Get the reset status of the peripheral.

Parameters:
[in]ResetnPeripheral ID
Returns:
status_t

Reentrant: NO

Example: 

 #include <DAVE3.h>
 int main(void)
 {
    uint32_t status = 0;
    DAVE_Init();
    // Assert the module
    RESET001_AssertReset(PER0_ERU1);
    // Get the status  of the module
    status = RESET001_GetStatus(PER0_ERU1);
    if(status == 1)
    {
      // De-assert the module
      RESET001_DeassertReset(PER0_ERU1);
    }
  }
